Attached is the Renewal Inspection Report for the above referenced facility completed on
03/03/2020. The study has determined substantial compliance with applicable licensing
statutes and rules, sections of the contract and Implementation Sustainability Exit Plan

violations of the MSA and your contract. As indicated above substantial compliance has
been established therefore, your license is renewed.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at (248) 975-5053.

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
1.) The facility is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes.
2.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also an ISEP violation. Please note that there
are additional ISEP requirements that may not be included in section 1. The facility
is in compliance will all additional ISEP requirements except for the following: Facility
is in compliance.
3.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also a DHHS Contract/Policy violation. Please
note that there are additional DHHS Contract/Policy requirements that may not be
included in section 1. The facility is in compliance will all additional DHHS
Contract/Policy requirements except for the following: Facility is in compliance.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was offered technical assistance in the following areas: None at this time.
V. CONSULTATION
The facility was offered consultation in the following areas:
 Social work contact section is a summary for each dated entry. It is not for
chronological listing, storage of actual emails.
 Review mandated reporter policy at team meetings.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There are no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
Mott Children Residence submitted seven acceptable corrective action plans not
related to maltreatment during this licensing period. Mott Children Residence is in
compliance with each corrective action plan.
 04/2019 Interim inspection - Repeat violations are not found in this inspection
period. Compliance is met.
 2019C0217044 cited R 400.4159 Resident restraint - Staff transported a
resident not in a Therapeutic Crisis Intervention hold. R 400.4109 Program
statement - Staff failed to address the resident’s needs. Staff involved were
disciplined and completed restraint refresher training. Restraints are reviewed
within 24 hours of the incident to verify appropriateness.
 2019C0217048 cited R 400.4158 Discipline - Staff pushed a resident on to a
bed after being hit by the resident. The staff person was terminated.
 2019C0217049 cited R 400.4127 Staff to resident ratio - Staff did not complete
variable interval eye-on checks during third shift. Supervisors now complete
unannounced visits on third shift to ensure checks are completed.
 2019C0217050 cited R 400.4127 Staff to resident ratio - Residents were in
their bedrooms for over 15 minutes during shift change. Start and end time of
4

shift change is now documented on the daily report and supervisory approval
is needed if shift change exceeds 15-minutes.
 2019C0217051 cited R 400.4127 Staff to resident ratio - Staff did not complete
15-minute bedroom checks. The staff person was disciplined. The corrective
action plan is the same as 2019C0217049 because the investigations occurred
around the same time.
 2019C0217053 cited R 400.4159 Resident restraint - Staff held a resident’s
wrists and arms in a transport. The staff person was disciplined and completed
a restraint refresher training.
VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing
statutes and rules and/or ISEP requirements and/or contract and policy. It is
recommended that the facility be issued a renewal of their regular license.
